results.title: Machine operation
results.creator_credit: De Frenes and United States. Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic typing”.
Demonstrates correct stroking at speeds ranging from 35 to 180 words per minute. Explains the functions of the various parts of the typewriter and demonstrates the use of these on various types of machines. Demonstrates how to attain correct touch for noiseless, manual, and electric machines.
results.description:

results.title: Methods
results.creator_credit: De Frenes and United States. Navy
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic typing”.
Demonstrates the correct posture for typing and proper fingering of the keys; shows the use of the shift key, back spaces, tabulator, carriage return lever, and other parts on both manual and electric machines; also discusses the funtion of various fixtures on the machine. Correct use of single sheets and carbon pack is also demonstrated, together with the use of the paper lever and carriage release lever.

Correct use of single sheets and carbon pack is also demonstrated, together with the use of the paper lever and carriage release lever.

results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Chants populaires”.
Animated scenes illustrate two French folk songs. ‘En passant’ 2.00 mins. ‘C’est l’aviron’ 3.16 mins. Featuring the Alouette Quartet and L’Assistance.

results.title: C'est l'aviron
results.creator_credit: Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chants populaires”.
A short animated version of a French folk song. McLaren used gouache drawings which he superimposed against a scenic background to give the impression of a boat travelling along a lake and river which he acheived by zooming during the photographic process.

results.title: La-haut sur ces montagnes. C'est l'aviron.
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Chants populaires”.
Animated interpretation of two French folk songs. Featuring Madeleine Lachance and the Quatuor Alouette. ‘La-haut sur ces montagnes’ (2.59 mins) is set on the island of Orleans near Quebec, where traditional dances and folksongs are kept alive by the peasant community. In ‘C’est l’aviron’ (3.15 mins) McLaren used gouache drawings which he superimposed against a scenic background to give the impression of a boat travelling along a lake and river which he acheived by zooming during the photographic process.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Palardy, Norman McLaren and National Film Board of Canada
results.description:
